text: Psalm 113
God’s Majesty and Care for the Needy
Praise Yah!\f + \fr 113:1 \ft Hebrew \fqa hallelujah \ft  \f*
Praise, O servants of Yahweh,
praise the name of Yahweh.
Let the name of Yahweh be blessed,
from now until forever.
From \add the\add* rising of \add the\add* sun to its setting,
\add let\add* the name of Yahweh be blessed.
Yahweh \add is\add* high above all nations;
his glory \add is\add* above the heavens.
Who \add is\add* like Yahweh our God,
who \add is\add* enthroned on high,\f + \fr 113:5 \ft Or “who dwells on high” \f*
who ⸤condescends to look at⸥\f + \fr 113:6 \ft Hebrew “makes low to see” \f*
\add what is\add* in the heavens and in the earth?
\add He\add* raises \add the\add* helpless from \add the\add* dust;
he lifts \add the\add* needy from \add the\add* ash heap,
to seat \add them\add* with princes,
with the princes of his people.
\add He\add* causes the barren woman of the house to dwell
\add as\add* the happy mother of children.
Praise Yah!\f + \fr 113:9 \ft Hebrew \fqa hallelujah \ft  \f*
